meanings.definition: To eat more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outeating her brother at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: He always ends up outeating his friends at the buffet.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce, but she was the champion of outeating.
meanings.sent4: Her appetite was like a bottomless pit, always outeating everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The image of her outeating the entire pizza will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.sent1: After the hike, they were outeating all the snacks they had packed.
meanings.sent2: It's not healthy to keep outeating sugary treats every day.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was outeating to prepare for hibernation like a bear.
meanings.sent4: The fridge seemed to be magically refilling itself as she kept outeating.
meanings.sent5: The sight of him outeating the entire cake was both impressive and concerning.

meanings.sent1: She managed to outeat all her competitors in the hot dog eating contest.
meanings.sent2: The challenge was to outeat the reigning champion, and he did it with ease.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outeat the dog's food, thinking it must be better.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of appetites, he always outate everyone else.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outeat even the biggest portions amazed everyone at the table.
